domains.description: Console domain defines methods and events for interaction with the JavaScript console. Console collects messages created by means of the JavaScript Console API. One needs to enable this domain using enable command in order to start receiving the console messages. Browser collects messages issued while console domain is not enabled as well and reports them using messageAdded notification upon enabling.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script ID of the message origin.

properties.name: line
properties.description: Line number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Message parameters in case of the formatted message.

properties.name: stack
properties.description: JavaScript stack trace for assertions and error messages.

properties.name: networkRequestId
properties.description: Identifier of the network request associated with this message.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Timestamp, when this message was fired.

properties.name: executionContextId
properties.description: Identifier of the context where this message was created

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables console domain, sends the messages collected so far to the client by means of the messageAdded notification.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables console domain, prevents further console messages from being reported to the client.

commands.name: clearMessages
commands.description: Clears console messages collected in the browser.

events.name: messageAdded
events.description: Issued when new console message is added.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Console message that has been added.

events.name: messageRepeatCountUpdated
events.description: Is not issued. Will be gone in the future versions of the protocol.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: New repeat count value.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of most recent message in batch.

events.name: messagesCleared
events.description: Issued when console is cleared. This happens either upon clearMessages command or after page navigation.

types.description: The security level of a page or resource.
An explanation of an factor contributing to the security state.

properties.name: summary
properties.description: Short phrase describing the type of factor.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Full text explanation of the factor.

properties.name: ranInsecureContentStyle
properties.description: Security state representing a page that ran insecure content.

properties.name: displayedInsecureContentStyle
properties.description: Security state representing a page that displayed insecure content.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables tracking security state changes.

events.name: securityStateChanged
events.description: The security state of the page changed.

parameters.name: securityState
parameters.description: Security state.

parameters.description: List of explanations for the security state. If the overall security state is `insecure` or `warning`, at least one corresponding explanation should be included.

parameters.name: schemeIsCryptographic
parameters.description: True if the page was loaded over cryptographic transport such as HTTPS.

domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an id. This id can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that iframe owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

types.description: Unique DOM node identifier used to reference a node that may not have been pushed to the front-end.
Backend node with a friendly name.
DOM interaction is implemented in terms of mirror objects that represent the actual DOM nodes. DOMNode is a base node mirror type.

domains.description: This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects (stylesheets, rules, and styles) have an associated id used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has a specific id structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds. CSS objects can be loaded using the get*ForNode() calls (which accept a DOM node id). A client can also discover all the existing stylesheets with the getAllStyleSheets() method (or keeping track of the styleSheetAdded/styleSheetRemoved events) and subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the getStyleSheet[Text]() methods.

types.description: Stylesheet type: "injected" for stylesheets injected via extension, "user-agent" for user-agent stylesheets, "inspector" for stylesheets created by the inspector (i.e. those holding the "via inspector" rules), "regular" for regular stylesheets.
CSS rule collection for a single pseudo style.

types.description: Match data for a CSS rule.

types.description: Data for a simple selector (these are delimited by commas in a selector list).

properties.description: The css style sheet identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified stylesheet rules) this rule came from.

properties.name: media
properties.description: Media list array (for rules involving media queries). The array enumerates media queries starting with the innermost one, going outwards.

types.description: Text range within a resource. All numbers are zero-based.

properties.name: important
properties.description: Whether the property has "!important" annotation (implies false if absent).

properties.name: styleSheetId
properties.description: The css style sheet identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified stylesheet rules) this rule came from.

properties.name: shorthandEntries
properties.description: Computed values for all shorthands found in the style.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Style declaration range in the enclosing stylesheet (if available).

properties.name: important
properties.description: Whether the property has "!important" annotation (implies false if absent).

properties.name: implicit
properties.description: Whether the property is implicit (implies false if absent).

properties.name: text
properties.description: The full property text as specified in the style.

properties.name: parsedOk
properties.description: Whether the property is understood by the browser (implies true if absent).

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Whether the property is disabled by the user (present for source-based properties only).

properties.name: range
properties.description: The entire property range in the enclosing style declaration (if available).

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the media query: "mediaRule" if specified by a @media rule, "importRule" if specified by an @import rule, "linkedSheet" if specified by a "media" attribute in a linked stylesheet's LINK tag, "inlineSheet" if specified by a "media" attribute in an inline stylesheet's STYLE tag.

properties.name: sourceURL
properties.description: URL of the document containing the media query description.

properties.name: range
properties.description: The associated rule (@media or @import) header range in the enclosing stylesheet (if available).

properties.name: styleSheetId
properties.description: Identifier of the stylesheet containing this object (if exists).

properties.name: active
properties.description: Whether the media query condition is satisfied.

properties.name: valueRange
properties.description: The associated range of the value text in the enclosing stylesheet (if available).

properties.name: computedLength
properties.description: Computed length of media query expression (if applicable).

types.description: Information about amount of glyphs that were rendered with given font.

properties.name: familyName
properties.description: Font's family name reported by platform.

properties.name: isCustomFont
properties.description: Indicates if the font was downloaded or resolved locally.

properties.name: glyphCount
properties.description: Amount of glyphs that were rendered with this font.

properties.name: styleSheetId
properties.description: The css style sheet identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified stylesheet rules) this rule came from.

types.description: A descriptor of operation to mutate style declaration text.

properties.name: range
properties.description: The range of the style text in the enclosing stylesheet.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables the CSS agent for the given page. Clients should not assume that the CSS agent has been enabled until the result of this command is received.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables the CSS agent for the given page.

commands.name: getMatchedStylesForNode
commands.description: Returns requested styles for a DOM node identified by nodeId.

returns.name: inlineStyle
returns.description: Inline style for the specified DOM node.

returns.name: attributesStyle
returns.description: Attribute-defined element style (e.g. resulting from "width=20 height=100%").

returns.name: matchedCSSRules
returns.description: CSS rules matching this node, from all applicable stylesheets.

returns.name: pseudoElements
returns.description: Pseudo style matches for this node.

returns.name: inherited
returns.description: A chain of inherited styles (from the immediate node parent up to the DOM tree root).

returns.name: cssKeyframesRules
returns.description: A list of CSS keyframed animations matching this node.

commands.name: getInlineStylesForNode
commands.description: Returns the styles defined inline (explicitly in the "style" attribute and implicitly, using DOM attributes) for a DOM node identified by nodeId.

returns.name: inlineStyle
returns.description: Inline style for the specified DOM node.

returns.name: attributesStyle
returns.description: Attribute-defined element style (e.g. resulting from "width=20 height=100%").

commands.name: getComputedStyleForNode
commands.description: Returns the computed style for a DOM node identified by nodeId.

returns.name: computedStyle
returns.description: Computed style for the specified DOM node.

commands.name: getPlatformFontsForNode
commands.description: Requests information about platform fonts which we used to render child TextNodes in the given node.

returns.name: fonts
returns.description: Usage statistics for every employed platform font.

commands.name: getStyleSheetText

returns.name: text
returns.description: The stylesheet text.

returns.name: sourceMapURL
returns.description: URL of source map associated with script (if any).

commands.name: setRuleSelector
commands.description: Modifies the rule selector.

returns.name: selectorList
returns.description: The resulting selector list after modification.

commands.name: setKeyframeKey
commands.description: Modifies the keyframe rule key text.

returns.name: keyText
returns.description: The resulting key text after modification.

commands.name: setStyleTexts
commands.description: Applies specified style edits one after another in the given order.

returns.name: styles
returns.description: The resulting styles after modification.

commands.name: setMediaText
commands.description: Modifies the rule selector.

returns.name: media
returns.description: The resulting CSS media rule after modification.

commands.name: createStyleSheet
commands.description: Creates a new special "via-inspector" stylesheet in the frame with given frameId.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Identifier of the frame where "via-inspector" stylesheet should be created.

returns.name: styleSheetId
returns.description: Identifier of the created "via-inspector" stylesheet.

commands.name: addRule
commands.description: Inserts a new rule with the given ruleText in a stylesheet with given styleSheetId, at the position specified by location.

parameters.name: styleSheetId
parameters.description: The css style sheet identifier where a new rule should be inserted.

parameters.name: ruleText
parameters.description: The text of a new rule.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Text position of a new rule in the target style sheet.

returns.name: rule
returns.description: The newly created rule.

commands.name: forcePseudoState
commands.description: Ensures that the given node will have specified pseudo-classes whenever its style is computed by the browser.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: The element id for which to force the pseudo state.

parameters.name: forcedPseudoClasses
parameters.description: Element pseudo classes to force when computing the element's style.

commands.name: getMediaQueries
commands.description: Returns all media queries parsed by the rendering engine.

commands.name: setEffectivePropertyValueForNode
commands.description: Find a rule with the given active property for the given node and set the new value for this property

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: The element id for which to set property.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to get background colors for.

returns.name: backgroundColors
returns.description: The range of background colors behind this element, if it contains any visible text. If no visible text is present, this will be undefined. In the case of a flat background color, this will consist of simply that color. In the case of a gradient, this will consist of each of the color stops. For anything more complicated, this will be an empty array. Images will be ignored (as if the image had failed to load).

events.name: mediaQueryResultChanged
events.description: Fires whenever a MediaQuery result changes (for example, after a browser window has been resized.) The current implementation considers only viewport-dependent media features.

events.name: styleSheetChanged
events.description: Fired whenever a stylesheet is changed as a result of the client operation.

events.name: styleSheetAdded
events.description: Fired whenever an active document stylesheet is added.

parameters.name: header
parameters.description: Added stylesheet metainfo.

events.name: styleSheetRemoved
events.description: Fired whenever an active document stylesheet is removed.

parameters.name: styleSheetId
parameters.description: Identifier of the removed stylesheet.

parameters.name: styleSheetId
parameters.description: Identifier of the stylesheet where the modification occurred.

parameters.name: changeRange
parameters.description: Range where the modification occurred.

domains.description: Input/Output operations for streams produced by DevTools.

commands.name: read
commands.description: Read a chunk of the stream

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: Handle of the stream to read.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Seek to the specified offset before reading (if not specificed, proceed with offset following the last read).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of bytes to read (left upon the agent discretion if not specified).

returns.name: data
returns.description: Data that were read.

returns.name: eof
returns.description: Set if the end-of-file condition occured while reading.

commands.name: close
commands.description: Close the stream, discard any temporary backing storage.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: Handle of the stream to close.

domains.description: DOM debugging allows setting breakpoints on particular DOM operations and events. JavaScript execution will stop on these operations as if there was a regular breakpoint set.

commands.name: setDOMBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular operation with DOM.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the operation to stop upon.

commands.name: removeDOMBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes DOM breakpoint that was set using setDOMBreakpoint.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to remove breakpoint from.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the breakpoint to remove.

commands.name: setEventListenerBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular DOM event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: DOM Event name to stop on (any DOM event will do).

parameters.name: targetName
parameters.description: EventTarget interface name to stop on. If equal to "*" or not provided, will stop on any EventTarget.

commands.name: removeEventListenerBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes breakpoint on particular DOM event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Event name.

parameters.name: targetName
parameters.description: EventTarget interface name.

commands.name: setInstrumentationBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular native event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Instrumentation name to stop on.

commands.name: removeInstrumentationBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes breakpoint on particular native event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Instrumentation name to stop on.

commands.name: setXHRBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on XMLHttpRequest.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring. All XHRs having this substring in the URL will get stopped upon.

commands.name: removeXHRBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes breakpoint from XMLHttpRequest.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring.

commands.name: getEventListeners
commands.description: Returns event listeners of the given object.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to return listeners for.

returns.name: listeners
returns.description: Array of relevant listeners.

properties.name: scriptLastModified
properties.description: The Last-Modified header value of the main script.

properties.name: scriptResponseTime
properties.description: The time at which the response headers of the main script were received from the server.  For cached script it is the last time the cache entry was validated.

properties.name: x
properties.description: X coordinate of the event relative to the main frame's viewport.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Y coordinate of the event relative to the main frame's viewport. 0 refers to the top of the viewport and Y increases as it proceeds towards the bottom of the viewport.

properties.name: radiusX
properties.description: X radius of the touch area (default: 1).

properties.name: radiusY
properties.description: Y radius of the touch area (default: 1).

properties.name: id
properties.description: Identifier used to track touch sources between events, must be unique within an event.

commands.name: dispatchKeyEvent
commands.description: Dispatches a key event to the page.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the key event.

parameters.name: modifiers
parameters.description: Bit field representing pressed modifier keys. Alt=1, Ctrl=2, Meta/Command=4, Shift=8 (default: 0).

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Time at which the event occurred. Measured in UTC time in seconds since January 1, 1970 (default: current time).

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text as generated by processing a virtual key code with a keyboard layout. Not needed for for keyUp and rawKeyDown events (default: "")

parameters.name: unmodifiedText
parameters.description: Text that would have been generated by the keyboard if no modifiers were pressed (except for shift). Useful for shortcut (accelerator) key handling (default: "").

parameters.name: keyIdentifier
parameters.description: Unique key identifier (e.g., 'U+0041') (default: "").

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Unique DOM defined string value for each physical key (e.g., 'KeyA') (default: "").

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Unique DOM defined string value describing the meaning of the key in the context of active modifiers, keyboard layout, etc (e.g., 'AltGr') (default: "").

parameters.name: windowsVirtualKeyCode
parameters.description: Windows virtual key code (default: 0).

parameters.name: nativeVirtualKeyCode
parameters.description: Native virtual key code (default: 0).

parameters.name: autoRepeat
parameters.description: Whether the event was generated from auto repeat (default: false).

parameters.name: isKeypad
parameters.description: Whether the event was generated from the keypad (default: false).

parameters.name: isSystemKey
parameters.description: Whether the event was a system key event (default: false).

commands.name: dispatchMouseEvent
commands.description: Dispatches a mouse event to the page.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the mouse event.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of the event relative to the main frame's viewport.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the event relative to the main frame's viewport. 0 refers to the top of the viewport and Y increases as it proceeds towards the bottom of the viewport.

parameters.name: modifiers
parameters.description: Bit field representing pressed modifier keys. Alt=1, Ctrl=2, Meta/Command=4, Shift=8 (default: 0).

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Time at which the event occurred. Measured in UTC time in seconds since January 1, 1970 (default: current time).

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: Mouse button (default: "none").

parameters.name: clickCount
parameters.description: Number of times the mouse button was clicked (default: 0).

commands.name: dispatchTouchEvent
commands.description: Dispatches a touch event to the page.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the touch event.

parameters.name: touchPoints
parameters.description: Touch points.

parameters.name: modifiers
parameters.description: Bit field representing pressed modifier keys. Alt=1, Ctrl=2, Meta/Command=4, Shift=8 (default: 0).

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Time at which the event occurred. Measured in UTC time in seconds since January 1, 1970 (default: current time).

commands.name: emulateTouchFromMouseEvent
commands.description: Emulates touch event from the mouse event parameters.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the mouse event.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of the mouse pointer in DIP.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the mouse pointer in DIP.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Time at which the event occurred. Measured in UTC time in seconds since January 1, 1970.

parameters.name: button

parameters.name: deltaX
parameters.description: X delta in DIP for mouse wheel event (default: 0).

parameters.name: deltaY
parameters.description: Y delta in DIP for mouse wheel event (default: 0).

parameters.name: modifiers
parameters.description: Bit field representing pressed modifier keys. Alt=1, Ctrl=2, Meta/Command=4, Shift=8 (default: 0).

parameters.name: clickCount
parameters.description: Number of times the mouse button was clicked (default: 0).

commands.name: synthesizePinchGesture
commands.description: Synthesizes a pinch gesture over a time period by issuing appropriate touch events.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of the start of the gesture in CSS pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the start of the gesture in CSS pixels.

parameters.name: scaleFactor
parameters.description: Relative scale factor after zooming (>1.0 zooms in, <1.0 zooms out).

parameters.name: relativeSpeed
parameters.description: Relative pointer speed in pixels per second (default: 800).

parameters.name: gestureSourceType
parameters.description: Which type of input events to be generated (default: 'default', which queries the platform for the preferred input type).

commands.name: synthesizeScrollGesture
commands.description: Synthesizes a scroll gesture over a time period by issuing appropriate touch events.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of the start of the gesture in CSS pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the start of the gesture in CSS pixels.

parameters.name: xDistance
parameters.description: The distance to scroll along the X axis (positive to scroll left).

parameters.name: yDistance
parameters.description: The distance to scroll along the Y axis (positive to scroll up).

parameters.name: xOverscroll
parameters.description: The number of additional pixels to scroll back along the X axis, in addition to the given distance.

parameters.name: yOverscroll
parameters.description: The number of additional pixels to scroll back along the Y axis, in addition to the given distance.

parameters.name: preventFling
parameters.description: Prevent fling (default: true).

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Swipe speed in pixels per second (default: 800).

parameters.name: gestureSourceType
parameters.description: Which type of input events to be generated (default: 'default', which queries the platform for the preferred input type).

parameters.name: repeatCount
parameters.description: The number of times to repeat the gesture (default: 0).

parameters.name: repeatDelayMs
parameters.description: The number of milliseconds delay between each repeat. (default: 250).

parameters.name: interactionMarkerName
parameters.description: The name of the interaction markers to generate, if not empty (default: "").

commands.name: synthesizeTapGesture
commands.description: Synthesizes a tap gesture over a time period by issuing appropriate touch events.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of the start of the gesture in CSS pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the start of the gesture in CSS pixels.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration between touchdown and touchup events in ms (default: 50).

parameters.name: tapCount
parameters.description: Number of times to perform the tap (e.g. 2 for double tap, default: 1).

parameters.name: gestureSourceType
parameters.description: Which type of input events to be generated (default: 'default', which queries the platform for the preferred input type).

types.description: Configuration for memory dump. Used only when "memory-infra" category is enabled.

properties.name: recordMode
properties.description: Controls how the trace buffer stores data.

properties.name: syntheticDelays
properties.description: Configuration to synthesize the delays in tracing.

properties.description: Configuration for memory dump triggers. Used only when "memory-infra" category is enabled.

parameters.description: Category/tag filter

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Tracing options

parameters.name: bufferUsageReportingInterval
parameters.description: If set, the agent will issue bufferUsage events at this interval, specified in milliseconds

parameters.name: transferMode
parameters.description: Whether to report trace events as series of dataCollected events or to save trace to a stream (defaults to ReportEvents).

commands.name: end

events.name: tracingComplete
events.description: Signals that tracing is stopped and there is no trace buffers pending flush, all data were delivered via dataCollected events.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: A handle of the stream that holds resulting trace data.

parameters.name: percentFull
parameters.description: A number in range [0..1] that indicates the used size of event buffer as a fraction of its total size.

parameters.name: eventCount
parameters.description: An approximate number of events in the trace log.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: A number in range [0..1] that indicates the used size of event buffer as a fraction of its total size.

domains.description: Runtime domain exposes JavaScript runtime by means of remote evaluation and mirror objects. Evaluation results are returned as mirror object that expose object type, string representation and unique identifier that can be used for further object reference. Original objects are maintained in memory unless they are either explicitly released or are released along with the other objects in their object group.

types.description: Mirror object referencing original JavaScript object.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: className
properties.description: Object class (constructor) name. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Remote object value in case of primitive values or JSON values (if it was requested), or description string if the value can not be JSON-stringified (like NaN, Infinity, -Infinity, -0).

properties.name: preview
properties.description: Preview containing abbreviated property values. Specified for object type values only.

types.description: Object containing abbreviated remote object value.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: overflow
properties.description: True iff some of the properties or entries of the original object did not fit.

properties.name: entries
properties.description: List of the entries. Specified for map and set subtype values only.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Object type. Accessor means that the property itself is an accessor property.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for object type values only.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Preview of the key. Specified for map-like collection entries.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

properties.name: writable
properties.description: True if the value associated with the property may be changed (data descriptors only).

properties.name: get
properties.description: A function which serves as a getter for the property, or undefined if there is no getter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: set
properties.description: A function which serves as a setter for the property, or undefined if there is no setter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: configurable
properties.description: True if the type of this property descriptor may be changed and if the property may be deleted from the corresponding object.

properties.name: enumerable
properties.description: True if this property shows up during enumeration of the properties on the corresponding object.

properties.name: wasThrown
properties.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

properties.name: isOwn
properties.description: True if the property is owned for the object.

properties.name: symbol
properties.description: Property symbol object, if the property is of the symbol type.

types.description: Object internal property descriptor. This property isn't normally visible in JavaScript code.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

types.description: Represents function call argument. Either remote object id objectId or primitive value or neither of (for undefined) them should be specified.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Primitive value, or description string if the value can not be JSON-stringified (like NaN, Infinity, -Infinity, -0).

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique id of the execution context. It can be used to specify in which execution context script evaluation should be performed.

properties.name: isDefault
properties.description: Whether context is the default page context (as opposite to e.g. context of content script).

properties.name: name
properties.description: Human readable name describing given context.

properties.name: frameId
properties.description: Id of the owning frame. May be an empty string if the context is not associated with a frame.

types.description: Detailed information on exception (or error) that was thrown during script compilation or execution.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script ID of the message origin.

properties.name: line
properties.description: Line number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: column
properties.description: Column number in the resource that generated this message.

properties.name: stack
properties.description: JavaScript stack trace for assertions and error messages.

types.description: Stack entry for runtime errors and assertions.
Call frames for assertions or error messages.

properties.name: description
properties.description: String label of this stack trace. For async traces this may be a name of the function that initiated the async call.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: Asynchronous JavaScript stack trace that preceded this stack, if available.

commands.name: evaluate
commands.description: Evaluates expression on global object.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: Expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects.

parameters.name: includeCommandLineAPI
parameters.description: Determines whether Command Line API should be available during the evaluation.

parameters.name: doNotPauseOnExceptionsAndMuteConsole
parameters.description: Specifies whether evaluation should stop on exceptions and mute console. Overrides setPauseOnException state.

parameters.name: contextId
parameters.description: Specifies in which isolated context to perform evaluation. Each content script lives in an isolated context and this parameter may be used to specify one of those contexts. If the parameter is omitted or 0 the evaluation will be performed in the context of the inspected page.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Whether execution should be treated as initiated by user in the UI.

returns.name: result

returns.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

returns.name: exceptionDetails

parameters.name: generatePreview

returns.name: result

returns.name: exceptionDetails

domains.description: Debugger domain exposes JavaScript debugging capabilities. It allows setting and removing breakpoints, stepping through execution, exploring stack traces, etc.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script identifier as reported in the Debugger.scriptParsed.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Location of the function, none for native functions.

properties.description: Whether this is a generator function.

properties.name: location
properties.description: If suspended, location where generator function was suspended (e.g. location of the last 'yield'). Otherwise, location of the generator function.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Entry key of a map-like collection, otherwise not provided.

types.description: JavaScript call frame. Array of call frames form the call stack.

properties.name: callFrameId
properties.description: Call frame identifier. This identifier is only valid while the virtual machine is paused.

properties.name: functionName
properties.description: Name of the JavaScript function called on this call frame.

properties.name: scopeChain
properties.description: Scope chain for this call frame.

properties.name: returnValue
properties.description: The value being returned, if the function is at return point.

properties.description: Object representing the scope. For global and with scopes it represents the actual object; for the rest of the scopes, it is artificial transient object enumerating scope variables as its properties.

commands.name: enable

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables debugger for given page.

commands.name: setBreakpointsActive
commands.description: Activates / deactivates all breakpoints on the page.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: New value for breakpoints active state.

commands.description: Makes page not interrupt on any pauses (breakpoint, exception, dom exception etc).

parameters.name: skipped
parameters.description: New value for skip pauses state.

commands.name: setBreakpointByUrl
commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at given location specified either by URL or URL regex. Once this command is issued, all existing parsed scripts will have breakpoints resolved and returned in locations property. Further matching script parsing will result in subsequent breakpointResolved events issued. This logical breakpoint will survive page reloads.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resources to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: urlRegex
parameters.description: Regex pattern for the URLs of the resources to set breakpoints on. Either url or urlRegex must be specified.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Offset in the line to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will only stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

returns.name: locations
returns.description: List of the locations this breakpoint resolved into upon addition.

commands.name: setBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at a given location.

parameters.name: location

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

returns.name: actualLocation
returns.description: Location this breakpoint resolved into.

parameters.description: Array of regexps that will be used to check script url for blackbox state.

VM will try leave blacklisted scripts by performing 'step in' several times, finally resorting to 'step out' if unsuccessful. Positions array contains positions where blackbox state is changed. First interval isn't blackboxed. Array should be sorted.
